Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2009 12:11AM K34 wrote: Hi Trabby I wanted to post as I recently had an ultrasound and specifically asked them to scan the whole breast and the other. They said the reason they only scan the area of concern is that ultrasounds are not used as a diagnostic tool for areas where there is no concern as they can give a false positive. I don't know how old you are, but here in the UK (think the US is the same- I'm a US import but came here as a teenager) they don't really have a diagnostic tool for under 35s he was saying as mammos often can't pick up things in breast tissue of the under 35s as it is too dense, so it relies a lot on the woman to be breast aware, and then an exam and an ultrasound can verify an area of concern.  I am sorry for you that they were unable to give you results- I fortunately had the radiologist there telling me it was nothing to worry about.  I hope you had the results you wanted.
